title: Can't get a viable ws or http connection to geth via node console

body: In order to start http or ws, you need to do `geth --http`. or `--ws`

I definitely am starting with 

`geth --ws --ws.port 8546 --ws.origins "*" --ws.api eth,net,web3`

The geth logs then say 

`WebSocket enabled url=ws://127.0.0.1:8546`

And yet when I try to use this endpoint from another computer, I get

```
> (node:26905) UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: connection not open on send()
    at Object.ConnectionError (/home/cyrus/node_modules/web3-core-helpers/lib/errors.js:66:23)
    at Object.ConnectionNotOpenError (/home/cyrus/node_modules/web3-core-helpers/lib/errors.js:49:21)
```
ufw on the host machine is inactive
nmap shows 

```
Host is up (0.00013s latency).
Not shown: 9999 closed ports
PORT   STATE SERVICE
22/tcp open  ssh

Nmap done: 1 IP address (1 host up) scanned in 0.12 seconds
```
I can ssh across the local network so it seems unlikely the router isn't doing something funky. 

Netstat on the host machine shows tcp running on 127.0.0.1:8546 and shows /geth at the line.

So why is my local machine reporting the connection error when attempting to interact with it?

Nevermind. I got it. I had to explicitly set the ws.addr to the local network hostname 192.168.1.121.

Thanks for your help.
Yeah 127.0.0.1 is localhost, you want to use 0.0.0.0 , or, what you eventually did.Â
